title: Geometric/Mechanical Display Face
content:
Any leads on this typeface would be great! Even if no exact matches are found, suggestions for typefaces with a similarly robust and mechanical feel are much appreciated.

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192828im_/http:/typophile.com/files/03_Rhinoshield_Packaging_Bravo_Company_on_BPO_6187.jpg)

Font: 

 Bender 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192828/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: thinkingwithtype

comments.content:
Very close to Bender, if you customize the A (flattened terminals to parallel baseline):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jovanny-lemonad/bender/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192828/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jovanny-lemonad/bender/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jovanny-lemonad/bender/")

Found a larger, head-on image. Given the R and the C, I think I can definitively ID this as Bender, with a customized A:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192828im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rhino-shield-screen-protector-google-nexus-10-expansys-1403-21-expansys@4_4703.jpg)

For similars, looking for "octagonal" would give you plenty of examples of the style, each with its quirks.  
One of the most known is probably House's United.  
Foundry Gridnik and Gestalten's Blender add a subtle rounding to the sharp corners.
Thanks kthomps5 & riccard0! Some really nice suggestions there.
